before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"mcud","text":"RNA degradation due to RNases is an ever present environmental risk to the samples.  Best lab practices regarding RNA handling including using RNase free plasticware, autoclaving tips and materials, cleaning the lab workspace, and wearing appropriate and clean lab coats and gloves should be followed at all times during this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d432m","text":"To evaluate the quality of RNA without the use of toxic chemicals, samples are run in a non-denaturing agarose \"bleach\" gel and product segregation is used to estimate RNA integrity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ddfpp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2oc8","text":"Be aware that in a non-denaturing gel, the RNA will not segregate strictly on particle size due to secondary structures of the molecules.  This method is for an estimation of quality only and the location of the banding in relation to a base pair ladder does not allow confident determination of the size of the RNA fragment.  If true fragment size determinations are required, RNA quality should be evaluated on a denaturing gel electrophoresis system.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":400,"length":53}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"572A64E0380911EC94FFBD496000C42D","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/us/en/home/references/protocols/nucleic-acid-purification-and-analysis/rna-protocol/agarose-gel-electrophoresis-of-rna.html"}}}}

funders.funder_name: Realizing Increased Photosynthetic Efficiency (RIPE) that is funded by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Foundation for Food and Agriculture Research, and the U.K. Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

keywords: RNA, QC, RNA Quality Control, Agarose Gel Electrophoresis, Bleach Agarose Gel
manuscript_citation: Aranda, P. S., LaJoie, D. M., & Jorcyk, C. L. (2012). Bleach gel: a simple agarose gel for analyzing RNA quality. Electrophoresis, 33(2), 366–369. https://doi.org/10.1002/elps.201100335

":"","data":{"guid":"CFBD25A0380E11EC94FFBD496000C42D","url":"https://www.fishersci.com/shop/products/fisherbrand-0-2ml-flat-domed-cap-pcr-tubes-10/14230225"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cn5gg","text":"Empty and rinse the gel electrophoresis tank with distilled water at least three times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9csd","text":"Dry the tank with paper towels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d95il","text":"Treat the gel electrophoresis tank, the gel casting system, the gel tray, and the gel comb with RNase Away.  Set up the gel tray and the gel casting system.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aecu4","text":"Prepare fresh 0.5X TAE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2chj1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9f8kl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":13,"offset":42}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f122i","text":"0.5X TAE is prepared by diluting 10 mL of 50X TAE stock with 990 mL distilled water.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"E5A0F750380B11EC94FFBD496000C42D","url":"http://cshprotocols.cshlp.org/content/2006/1/pdb.rec8644.full?text_only=true"},"mutability":"","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2q7kc","text":"Measure the appropriate volume of 0.5X TAE for the gel cast size you have selected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp30a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8144b","text":"      for a 10 x 15 cm tray.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fpnj0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"35B61B20380D11EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aaq0p","text":"Weigh molecular grade agarose to 1% of the volume of 0.5X TAE for the gel cast size you have selected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dm43","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gb6a","text":"  agarose for   of 0.5X TAE for a 10 x 15 cm tray.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"biv0u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"3902FC30380D11EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"3AE61410380D11EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"elgfv","text":"Pour the 0.5X TAE and the weighed agarose into an erlenmeyer flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"661uh","text":"Measure 1% bleach for the volume of 0.5X TAE for the gel cast size you have selected","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l8ef","text":"  6% sodium hypochlorite bleach for   of 0.5X TAE for a 10 x 15 cm tray.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"34cla","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"4830C9D0380D11EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"4AFF0500380D11EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1v3o","text":"Swirl the flask containing the 0.5X TAE, agarose, and bleach.  Allow it to incubate at  for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":86,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":92,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5jdun","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"5FAA2840380D11EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"63C94D70380D11EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"beb1t","text":"Place a kim wipe in the top of the flask to reduce evaporation and microwave on high until the solution is boiling, the agarose has dissolved, and no floaties or striations are visible in the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5sq6d","text":"Remove the kim wipe and allow the solution to cool to a temperature where the very top of the flask can be handled without hot pads. Gently swirling the flask will help speed cooling but be careful to avoid bubble formation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29m1v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7o23q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1r40","text":"If the solution is poured into the gel cast too hot, it can cause melting or warping of the plastic.  If the solution is poured too cold into the gel cast, it may begin to set and will not form a smooth glassy surfaced gel.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1l8hh","text":"Gently pour the agarose solution into the gel cast.  Try to minimize bubble formation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"391ha","text":"Pipette the appropriate volume of 1:20,000 Sybrsafe DNA stain for the gel cast size you have selected directly into the agarose solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4303u","text":"  Sybrsafe DNA Stain for   of 0.5X TAE for a 10 x 15 cm tray.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ffgn6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnp30","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ag01c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cr5vo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"FFA8C170380E11EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"F4D8322E380E11EC94010A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aj275","text":"Sybr Safe Manufacturer recommendation is 1:10,000 dilution.  Clear visualization of nucleic acids, except at very low concentrations, is possible at 1:20,000 dilution.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5r02k","text":"Mix the Sybrsafe DNA Stain into the liquid agarose solution using the pipette tip.  Try to evenly distribute the Sybrsafe throughout the gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bks5n","text":"Pop or push any bubbles that form to the sides of the gel cast using the pipette tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"40s39","text":"Insert the gel comb and gently rock it side to side to release any air bubbles trapped under the comb.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3b1h4","text":"Optional:  Level the gel cast before pouring the gel if images will be used in publications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rp25","text":"Allow the gel to set, approximately 20  minutes.  The gel will turn from clear to milky and from liquid to semi-solid when it is set.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4qej7","text":"Remove the gel comb.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sjsp","text":"Release the gel tray from the gel casting system and place the gel and gel tray in the gel electrophoresis tank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8skj2","text":"Fill the gel electrophoresis tank with fresh 0.5X TAE until the gel is covered by a few centimeters and no air bubbles remain in the wells of the gel where the comb was removed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"o2qb","text":"Prepare your RNA samples by adding   of RNA to   of 6X loading dye in a PCR tube.  Keep your prepared samples  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":47,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":110,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b64eg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9957k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77ubb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"46242990381011EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"487C7170381011EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"73ED0C70381011EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":165}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":174}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7qiv","text":"Keep your RNA samples on dry ice whenever you are not actively working with them to inhibit RNases.  RNases have been shown to retain activity even at temperatures as low as  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1g597","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"5FCC9D00381011EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10},"mutability":"","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0flr","text":"Load   of a prepared 1 kb nucleic acid ladder in the first well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1uqag","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"6","error":false,"guid":"858E9930381011EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cbth4","text":"Load   of your prepared RNA with loading dye into subsequent wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"69q94","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"6","error":false,"guid":"91EF1600381011EC94FFBD496000C42D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tm5b","text":"Run the gel at 200 V until desired separation is achieved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqt9l","text":"    For a 100 mL gel in 0.5X TAE, approximately 45-60 min.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vk61","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5mlua","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67mfa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9vk38","text":"The addition of bleach affects the ionic buffering capacity of the running buffer.  Additional voltage above what is typically used for a standard agarose gel may be needed when using a bleach agarose gel.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c30k","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4u8se","text":"Time will vary depending on strength of TAE, size of gel, percent agarose, voltage selected, and amount of RNA fragment separation is required.  If parameters outside this protocol are used, visually check separation of gel using the visible loading dye until desired separation is achieved.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"croni","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9psjj","text":"If after visualization on the imaging system desired separation is not achieved, the gel can be returned to its tray, placed back in the gel electrophoresis system, and ran for a longer time period.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c2ifa","text":"Remove the gel from the gel electrophoresis system, slide the gel out of its tray on to the imaging tray of the Bio-Rad Gel Doc XR  Imager (or equivalent).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dlgp9","text":"Visualize the gel under UV imaging using Quantity One software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j0k4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f76mk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: RNA Quality Control Non-Denaturing Agarose "Bleach" Gel

versions.title: RNA Quality Control Non-Denaturing Agarose "Bleach" Gel

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"8bf1v","text":"Sybrsafe binds to nucleic acids. Proper PPE is recommended.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ae30","text":"Heating household bleach may release chlorine gas.  Use caution and if preparing large volumes of agarose bleach gels, consider moving the melting and gel setting step to a chemical fume hood.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
